Posts.Title: Would you mind sharing your age at time of diagnosis? ByFaith Gussy

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2017 03:36AM ParisParis wrote: I agree with all the descriptions, it does not hurt a lot with the lidocaine they give you first. It is really not such a big deal, Nothing to be afraid of. I returned to work immediately after the procedure and did Zumba at night.
Posts.Title: Core Biopsy Tomorrow - need advice LadyTL djmammo

Posts.Content: May 19, 2017 05:16AM - edited May 19, 2017 05:20AM by ParisParis Hello, I am sorry that you have to go through this. 4B still leaves a lot of hope that it is benign and MRI produces lots of false positives - one of the reasons (apart from the costs) why it is not used more for screening purposes! Hang in there!
Posts.Title: Three "moderately suspicious" masses- 4B AdaMarie80 ParisParis

Posts.Content: May 19, 2017 09:54PM ParisParis wrote: Dear Tyllgod, I am sorry to hear your story - of course you are worried! Try and relax (I know, easier said than done) but no amount of worrying will help in this situation. You can only take it step by step right now. Remember that most women who have a suspicious finding do not have cancer in the end. I wish you all the best!
